epicVotingSystem

Class VotingController

  • java.lang.Object
    • epicVotingSystem.VotingController

  • public class VotingController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manages file read/writes, voting calculations and data updates by the voting system
    Since:
    01/08/2016
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Tony Assadi

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      VotingController()
      Class constructor calls two functions, loadStaffData() and loadCandidateData() to load staff and candidate data from file.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      This method returns a Candidate object if found in the candidates ArrayList

      This methods is used to return collection of candidates as an Arraylist
      Staff getStaff(int id)
      This method returns a staff object if found in the staffs ArrayList
      int getTotalVoters()
      This methods is used to retrieve total number of staffs in the collection
      void loadCandidateData()
      This method loads candidates data from a comma-delimited text file ("candidates.txt"), located in the root directory of this project.
      void loadStaffData()
      This method loads staff data from a comma-delimited text file ("staff.txt"), located in the root directory of this project.
      void recordVote()
      This method is used to save every staff vote to file and update number of votes received by each Candidate.
      void saveCandidateData()
      This method writes candidates data back to file.

      This method writes staffs data back to file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • VotingController

        public VotingController()
        Class constructor calls two functions, loadStaffData() and loadCandidateData() to load staff and candidate data from file.

    • Method Detail

      • loadCandidateData

        public void loadCandidateData()
        This method loads candidates data from a comma-delimited text file ("candidates.txt"), located in the root directory of this project.
        Each candidate from file is loaded as an object "theCandidate" and then added to "candidates" Arraylist.

      • loadStaffData

        public void loadStaffData()
        This method loads staff data from a comma-delimited text file ("staff.txt"), located in the root directory of this project.
        Each staff from file is loaded as an object "theStaff" and then added to "staffs" Arraylist. *
        Since this a comma-delimited txt file, Changes to structure of how data is loaded from file must reflect "Staff class" and
        saveStaffData() function that save staff data back to file.

      • getStaff

        public Staff getStaff(int id)
        This method returns a staff object if found in the staffs ArrayList
        Parameters:
        id - staff id to search
        Returns:
        theStaff - staff object that matched search id

      • getCandidate

        public Candidate getCandidate(int candidateCode)
        This method returns a Candidate object if found in the candidates ArrayList
        Parameters:
        candidateCode - Candidate code to find
        Returns:
        theCandidate - Candidate object that matched search code

      • getCandidates

        public java.util.ArrayList<Candidate> getCandidates()
        This methods is used to return collection of candidates as an Arraylist
        Returns:
        ArrayList - list of candidates as an Arraylist

      • getTotalVoters

        public int getTotalVoters()
        This methods is used to retrieve total number of staffs in the collection
        Returns:
        int - total number of staff to vote

      • recordVote

        public void recordVote()
        This method is used to save every staff vote to file and update number of votes received by each Candidate.
        Once staff votes is updated for staff and candidate objects, This methods call two functions
        "saveStaffData()" and "saveCandidateData()" to write updated data for staff and candidates objects into file.

      • saveStaffData

        public void saveStaffData()
        This method writes staffs data back to file.
        Note : This method writes ALL data from staffs Arraylist back to file and data in the file is completely overwritten.
        Since this a comma-delimited txt file, changes to structure of data written to file in this method MUST reflect structure of staff class and
        loadStaffData() function that load staff data from file.

      • saveCandidateData

        public void saveCandidateData()
        This method writes candidates data back to file.
        Note : This method writes ALL data from candidates Arraylist back to file and data in the file is completely overwritten.
        Since this a comma-delimited txt file, changes to structure of data written to file in this method MUST reflect structure of Candidate class and
        loadCandidateData() function that load candidate data from file.
